sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Hello and welcome to Euronews Now. I'm Maryam Zahidi. Here are our headlines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The World Health Organization names the new COVID strain Omicron and calls it a variant of concern, as Belgium records the first case in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: President Macron accuses Boris Johnson of not being serious over the Prime Minister's tweet about solutions to the migrant crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: France tells the UK it's no longer invited to Sunday's summit on the issue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko tells migrants at the Polish border he won't force them to return home.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And in sports, we look ahead to some tantalising World Cup play-offs that could see heavyweights Italy or Portugal not qualify for Qatar 2022. As Belgian health officials confirm the first case of the B.1.1.529

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: COVID-19 strain in Europe, the WHO names it Omicron and calls it a variant of concern.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: First detected in South Africa, it's now been recorded in countries including Hong Kong, Botswana and Israel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Analysis by the World Health Organization shows the strain has multiple mutations that could render current vaccines obsolete.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The WHO have recommended against implementing travel restrictions, but the EU is advising member states to put an emergency brake on journeys from affected regions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It is now important that all of us in Europe act very swiftly, decisively and united.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The European Commission has today proposed to member states to activate the emergency brake on travel from countries in southern Africa and other countries affected to limit the spread of the new variant. All air travel to these countries should be suspended. They should be suspended until we have a clear understanding about the danger posed by this new variant. And travelers returning from this region should respect strict quarantine rules.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Belgium has announced new COVID-19 restrictions to tackle surging infections

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: and to stop the spread of Omicron variant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: From Brussels, Maeve McMahon says the government is calling it lockdown light.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Belgium's heading into a three-week lockdown, but it's a rather light lockdown, and it's hitting one sector particularly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: That's the hospitality and nightlife scene.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We can take a listen now to Alexander Ducrot, that's the Belgian Prime Minister, breaking the bad news down to the sector earlier in a press conference.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Unfortunately, discotheques and dance halls will have to close their doors again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And I fully understand that this is a harsh message after the solution that we thought we had found last week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We know that it's a very, very negative message.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But we really want to avoid too many people being too close to each other today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: There will also be an 11pm closing time for night shops.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Now pubs and restaurants are breathing a sigh of relief because they can stay open but only until 11pm.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Only six people can occupy a table and people are only allowed into restaurants if they have a COVID-safe pass.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Now, justifying these measures, Alexander de Croo said earlier that the situation regarding COVID-19 in Belgium was worse than the worst case scenario.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He said it's not even COVID-19 anymore, but rather COVID-21 because it's three times more infectious and three times more dangerous than COVID-19 ever was.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: more infectious and three times more dangerous than COVID-19 ever was.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And it's not just Belgium.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The Netherlands is also set to impose new restrictions in an attempt to contain the rapidly spreading virus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Our reporter Fernand van Tet says the government is aiming to relieve the pressure on the country's health service.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Seems like the ones behind me will be a thing of the past as of Sunday until at least Sunday, the 18th of December. The Dutch government announced that all restaurants and bars, cinemas and theaters will have to close their doors from 5 p.m.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Gyms, too, will have to shut their doors. Now, theaters and restaurants and cinemas can be open, but only filled to a third of capacity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And the reason for this is the immense pressure on the health care system here. The intensive care units are being flooded with victims. They can't handle it. Also, because there is less intensive care personnel available now than last year when we had similar numbers here. Now, the Dutch prime minister himself said also he was to blame for his communication, that people were not being tested enough. Only half of the people here, when they do have symptoms, actually get tested.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He really called upon people to start doing that again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But it's really the immense pressure on the health care system and the lack of capacity on intensive care units that has caused this situation here tonight.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: This is Fernand van Terts reporting for Euronews from Amsterdam. And staying with Covid and this new variant, I spoke to Professor Lawrence Young,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: virologist and professor of molecular oncology at the University of Warwick earlier.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Now, he said that given the deteriorating situation in Europe, we must closely watch any new variants that emerge.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: We know from looking at the genome of the virus that it's got some changes that we have seen before, but it's got more changes than we have ever seen before, all in one virus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: And knowing a little bit about what those changes mean in terms of transmissibility and the likelihood that this might result in some escape from the immune protection that we get from vaccines is a concern.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: But most of this is speculation at the moment. So we need to keep a close eye on the numbers. We can see them increasing quite rapidly in certain regions of South Africa. And as your reporter just said, you know, we know that one of the problems with these viruses is once they're out there, they're out there, they spread very rapidly. And so whilst border controls and cautions are important, the virus is likely to be already in a number of countries across Europe and across the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Right. And at the WHO, they've been cautious in their approach, but the EU and the UK, we see that they're moving to halt all travel between Southern Africa. But is this really enough, given that we've had this first case now identified in Europe?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: I think what we're doing here is just attempting to delay the inevitable. The inevitable is that this virus will be around the world very quickly. What we don't know is how fast it will spread once it gets into other countries and what it means for illness, how sick people would get from this infection, and what it means for the protection afforded by current vaccines. It is unlikely that even this extreme variant will be able to completely get around all of the vaccine protection, but we don't know yet, and that's what's needed to be studied.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Diplomatic relations between the UK and France have hit a new low with President Emmanuel Macron accusing Prime Minister Boris Johnson of the UK of not being serious about solutions to the migrant crisis. Macron's comments followed Johnson releasing a letter on Thursday night on Twitter in which he set out the government's response to dealing with the number of people trying to cross the English Channel from Calais.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Paris has now told London it's no longer invited to a summit involving the EU, Germany, Belgium, the Netherlands on Sunday in Calais.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: This crisis meeting was called following the death, of course, of 27 people who drowned, sadly, in the English Channel on Wednesday night.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I had a serious discussion with Prime Minister Johnson two days ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: For my part I intend to continue to apply what I do with all countries and all leaders. I am surprised by the methods when they're not serious.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: You don't communicate from one leader to another on issues such as this via tweets and letters that are made public.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We are not whistleblowers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Come on.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Allons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Allons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And staying with that story, from London, Victoria Smith says Boris Johnson made five, count them, five practical suggestions for cooperation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It has come off the back of a terrible incident, of course, this drowning, 27 people, the worst drowning in the English Channel on record. And of course, Boris Johnson has set out his stall in a long letter detailing five different ways in which he believes France and the UK should work together, such as sharing radar, sharing intelligence, sharing joint patrols, even sharing an aircraft and pushing France to perhaps act more quickly on returning migrants that reach the UK back to France. Now this hasn't gone down well at all.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Obviously Emmanuel Macron doesn't like being told what to do by the British Prime Minister, nor does he like it being shared on social media. This letter's gone onto Twitter and that perhaps wasn't seen as a diplomatic or a serious thing to do by President Macron, who's called it out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And as a result, the French have retaliated, and they have uninvited the Home Secretary here in the UK, Priti Patel, from this very important, this crucial summit in Europe on Sunday on the migrant crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Now, reports are saying that perhaps Boris Johnson has done this as a sort of show of strength to his own party, his own Conservatives.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And that may be true, but it certainly backfired in terms of a show of strength when it comes to France, who's now taken this retaliatory action against the UK.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Changing gears now to the President of Belarus, Alexander Lukashenko, who has told

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: migrants at the Polish border that he will not force them to return home on repatriation flights.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Matthew in the queue, Pesmo. Lukashenko's impromptu visit to the border was his first since the crisis erupted. For weeks now, hundreds of migrants, mostly from originally from the Middle East, have been stuck between the borders of Poland and Belarus while trying to enter the European Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The EU has accused the Belarusian President, Alexander Lukashenko, of waging a hybrid war, saying that he has lured migrants to his country with the promise of helping these people reach the West.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: But on Friday, the Belarusian President once again called on EU countries like Germany to take these migrants in.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: He made a stage visit to the village of Brugy here at the border where he met migrants at a makeshift detention center. In images that were published by Belarusian state media you can see Lukashenko being applauded by the crowds as he inspects the detention centers where they are being kept. Lukashenko telling these people that he won't force anyone who doesn't want to return home to do so, saying that he would't force anyone who doesn't want to return home to do so, saying that he would provide food and clothing to those people who chose to remain at the border.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Although hundreds of people have gotten repatriation flights to areas like northern Iraq from Belarus, it's estimated that there are still 2,000 people waiting to enter Poland and therefore at the EU's external frontier.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Warsaw for one say that although this number has decreased they say the situation has not changed accusing Belarus and Lukashenko of merely changing his tactics and brainwashing these migrants at the border. Indeed on Friday the Polish border guard said in a video on Twitter that migrants had destroyed a detention center in the country's west. Video showing people throwing equipment but they say the situation was eventually calmed however this week we've also seen Human Rights Watch and other organizations calling on both Poland and Belarus to address the situation there accusing both countries of quote serious abuses Marianne they say that while Belarus may have started this crisis Human Rights Watch accusing Poland of exacerbating the situation by not allowing humanitarian aid to those people who need it. Ukraine's president Vladimir Zelensky has alleged that

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Russia is backing a coup attempt to overthrow his government as early as next week. Zelensky said the move against him would also involve one of Ukraine's richest oligarchs. The Ukrainian leader also referenced Russia's mass buildup of troops near the border.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: But the Kremlin has strongly denied the claims and called concern over its military activity alarmist.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: For more, I'm joined now by our Russia analyst, Gelinka Polinskaya.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Gelinka, how did Russia respond then to this crisis?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Well, Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov said that Russia never engages in such things and that there have never been such plans.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We've heard that Mr. Zelensky mentioned Russians, a group of Russians and Ukrainians who organize a coup d'etat, and he also said that Rinat Akhmedov, a very rich Ukrainian man, could be also involved.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: This man is a mining and steel tycoon, and he also owns some media holdings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And recently, those media were sharply criticizing Mr. Zelensky.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We also know that several weeks ago, the president of Ukraine signed the so-called anti-oligarch bill, and it is aimed to deter the excessive influence of rich people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: There was also an idea to ban oligarchs from owing media, but this idea did not find its way into the bill. In any case, there are more questions than answers in this story. And Mr. Zelensky today said that it could be a setup for Mr. Akhmetov.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And so, Galina, Zelensky's comments come amid growing tensions between Kiev and Moscow over the buildup of Russian troops and military equipment along Ukraine's border. So what's President Putin really up to?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Well, many Kremlin observers think that the only person who knows the answer to this question at this point is Mr. Putin himself. Ukraine, very concerned about what is happening and fearing a military invasion in the east of the country controlled by the pro-Russian separatists, called on Europe and the US for help.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Mr. Putin called such allegations alarmist, and he said that Russia was responding to NATO provocations in the Black Sea, and said that it was the West who was destabilizing the situation in Ukraine by providing weapons to Kyiv. Some analysts think that such an invasion would be devastating first of all for Russia too costly and would not bring any additional approval popularity ratings to Mr. Putin as it happened in 2014 when Crimea was annexed and the conflict in Donbass started, others think that everything is possible if Russia really thinks that its red lines are crossed. And we know about Ukraine's aspirations to join NATO. And this is surely the last thing Mr. Putin would wish for.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Okay, Galina, thank you for that analysis there.

sentences.sentence: Now, the World Cup playoff draw has taken place

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09

sentences.sentence: Twelve countries, including Portugal and Italy, will go head-to-head with only three World Cup final places up for grabs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: For more, I'm now joined by sports presenter Will Dalton.
